gurmukhi: khM lwg gno niRp jOn Bey ] pRB joqih joq imlwie ley ]
transliteration: Kahan Laag Gado Nrip Jaoun Bhae|| Prabh Jotah(i) Jot Milaae Lae||
translation: How many kings were there and how many of them were merged by the Lord in his light? To what extent should I describe them.

gurmukhi: pun sRI piRQrwj piRQIs BXo ] ijn ib`pn dwn durMq dXo ]23]
transliteration: Poun Sriprithraaj Prithees Bhayo|| Jin Bippan Daan Durant Dayo||23||
translation: Then there was Prithu, the Lord of the earth, who donated enormous gifts to the Brahmins.23.

gurmukhi: dlu lY idn eyk iSkwr cVy ] bin inrjn mo liK bwG bVy ]
transliteration: Dal(u) Lai Din Ek Shikaar Chade|| Ban(i) Nirjan Mo Lakh(i) Baagh Bade||
translation: One day, in a desolate forest, seeing huge lions, he went hunting, along with his army, in order to attack them;

gurmukhi: qh nwr sukuMql qyj Dry ] sis sUrj kI liK kRwNq hry ]24]
transliteration: Tah Naar Soukountal Tej Ddare|| Sas(i) Sooraj Kilakh(i) Kraant Dare||24||
translation: There a women named Shakuntala, whose light bedimmed even the luster of the sun.24.

gurmukhi: qh jwq Bey ] miRg Gwq key ] iek dyK kutI ] jnu jog jutI ]25]
transliteration: Tah Jaat Bhae|| Mrig Ghaat Kae|| Ik Dekh Koutee|| Jan(u) Jog Joutee||25||
translation: After killing a deer and seeing a desolate cottage, the king reached there.25.

gurmukhi: qh jwq BXo ] sMg ko n lXo ] liK nwr KrI ] rs rIq BrI ]26]
transliteration: Tah Jaat Bhayo|| San Ko Na Layo|| Lakh(i) Naar Kdaree|| Ras Reet Bharee||26||
translation: He went there and there was none with him; he saw a very charming woman there.26.

gurmukhi: Aiq soBq hY ] liK loBq hY ] niRp pyKI jbY ] icq cauk qbY ]27]
transliteration: At(i) Sobhat Hai|| Lakh(i) Lobhat Hai|| Nrip Pekhijabai|| Chit Chaouk Tabai||27||
translation: Her glory coveted his mind, when the king saw her, his mind was startled.27.

gurmukhi: ieh kaun jeI ] jn rUp meI ] Cb dyK CkXo ] icq cwie ckXo ]28]
transliteration: Eh Kaoun Jaee|| Jan Roop Maee|| Chhab Dekh Chhakyo|| Chit Chaae Chadyo||28||
translation: The king though as to whose daughter that beautiful woman was; seeing here beauty the king saw allured and his mind fell in love with her.28.

gurmukhi: niRp bwh ghI ] qRIA mon rhI ] rs rIq rcXo ] duhUM mYn mcXo ]29]
transliteration: Nrip Baah Gadee|| Treea Mon Rahee|| Ras Reet Rachyo|| Duhoon Main Machyo||29||
translation: The king caught her arm and that woman kept silent; absorded and dyed with love, both became lustful.29.

gurmukhi: bhu BwNq BjI ] ins lO qjI ] doaU rIJ rhy ] nih jwq khy ]30]
transliteration: Bahu Bhaant Bhajee|| Nis Lau Na Tajee|| Dooo Reejh Rahe|| Nah(i) Jaat Kahe||30||
translation: The king enjoyed her in various ways till night both of them felt so much pleased with each other that is the not possible for me to narrate.30.

gurmukhi: rs rIq rcXo ] kl kyl mcXo ] Aimqwsn dy ] suK rwsn sy ]31]
transliteration: Ras Rit Rachyo|| Kal Kel Machyo|| Amitaasan De|| Soukh Raasan Se||31||
translation: Being absorbed and dyed with love, they kept engrossed in sexual enjoinment many types of postures.31.

gurmukhi: llqwsn lY ] ibbDwsn kY ] llnwru llw ] kir kwm klw ]32]
transliteration: Lalraasan Lai|| Bibdhaasan Kai|| Lalnaar(u) Lalaa|| Kar(i) Kaam Kalaa||32||
translation: They enjoyment the relish of various types of postures and in the way, both of them established their sexual sport.32.

gurmukhi: kir kyl auTI ] mD prn kutI ] niRp jwq BXo ] iqh grB rihXo ]33]
transliteration: Kar(i) Kel Outhee|| Madh Paran Koutee|| Nrip Jaat Bhayo|| Tih Gadabh Rahiyo||33||
translation: After that woman having enjoyed the sexual sport, came out of that cottage; the king went away and Shakuntala became pregnant.33.
